page.title: 05W. WEDLAKE- archaeologist
page.content: William Wedlake, now in his 80's, lives in the house in Camerton where he was born. He attended the local school until he was 13 when he began work on Camerton Farm to support his family whilst his father fought in World War 1.At school William became interested in archaeology, helping a former Headmaster set up a museum. Working on the farm he dug up relics which led to his career. His most notable find was the Camerton Discs-7th.C.AD bronze burial brooches. He worked abroad with Sir Mortimer Wheeler, but mostly he has researched, catalogued and written on local historic finds.
